sentences.english: The clerk assisted the judge by looking up related precedents.
sentences.chinese: 這位書記官協助那位法官查閱有關判例。

sentences.english: The clerk assisted the judge by looking up related precedents. Her breathing was assisted by a respirator.
sentences.chinese: 這位書記官協助那位法官查閱有關判例。

sentences.english: Some might see the overturning of Citizens United.
sentences.chinese: 有些人或許會顛覆聯邦公民的判例。

sentences.english: Two typical judicial precedents in Chinese legal history are Li and Cheng'an.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代歷史上典型的判例形式是例和成案。

sentences.english: The sheet number of decisions is an obvious obstacle to finding case law.
sentences.chinese: 判決的案卷號對於查詢判例是一個明顯的障礙。

sentences.english: American Law belongs to the Common Law legal system which mainly origins from case law.
sentences.chinese: 美國法屬於以判例爲主要法律淵源的普通法法系。

sentences.english: When he made the judgment, the judge had to follow the precedent which had been established in1920.
sentences.chinese: 法官在作出判決時只得參照一九二年樹立的判例。

sentences.english: Some of his statements on cases became classic and are cited widely.
sentences.chinese: 盧埃林一些關於判例的論述成爲大家引用的經典。

sentences.english: They were tripping one another up on slippery precedents.
sentences.chinese: 他們根據極不可靠的判例，彼此挑眼兒。

sentences.english: It relies on the establishment method, in addition to having no other characteristicses that legal source has case law outside.
sentences.chinese: 它依託制定法，除沒有法源外具有判例法的其他特點。

sentences.english: The bulk of American contract law is judge-made case law.
sentences.chinese: 美國合同法的大部分是由法官創制的判例法。

sentences.english: A fatwa is a medicine which has to be given by a qualified physician.
sentences.chinese: 判例就像醫藥，只有具備資格的藥劑師才能開出。

definition: judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
